result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar D Trejo Sosa

defendant.name: Trejo Sosa, Oscar D
defendant.address: 243 Bunting Ln, c/o Omar Trejo, Madison, WI 53704

records.addlTxt: Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

CASH BAIL OF $1000 PREVIOUSLY POSTED TO APPLY.
Cash bond is set in the amount of $2,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Daniella RM or Maria RM. 
- Defendant shall not be on N Thompson Dr. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 2300 block of Independence Ln. 
 Defendant shall not be at The St Dennis School. 
 Defendant shall not be at any Princeton Club location. 
 Defendant shall not be at The Foss Swimming School. 
Trial Judge - Br 7

1:40 PM Defendant Oscar Trejo Sosa in court, in custody.  Attorney Murali S. Jasti in court for Oscar Trejo Sosa.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Olsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Liesl Monroy duly sworn and interpreted. Victim appeared and made statement.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: set for bail hearing at same time as IA on new charges

2:08 PM Defendant Oscar D Trejo Sosa in court, in custody.  Attorney Crystal A Vera in court for Oscar D Trejo Sosa.  Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Jim Larson duly sworn & interpreted. Appearance by victims via Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statements by victims.
